shroud.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a cloth that is wrapped around a dead person’s body before it is buried
shroud.translation[0].definitions[1].def: something that hides or covers something
shroud.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: The fog rolled in, and a grey shroud covered the city.
A shroud of silence surrounded the general’s death.
shroud.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: Joseph was shrouded under a dark blanket.
The cliff was shrouded in mist.
shroud.translation[1].definitions[1].def: to keep information secret so that people do not know what really happened
shroud.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: The incident has always been shrouded in mystery.
The work is shrouded in secrecy.
